item.title: Npc wont attack back!
item.dc:creator: @Reforced _Reforced
item.description:
@Reforced wrote:

[quote="• Java Maybe •, post:21, topic:197700"][quote author=parkview link=topic=262308.msg2172545#msg2172545 date=1207710325]

how do we make it so the npcs actually attack back? (Proj Czar)
[/quote]Declare this:

public void attackBack() { sendMessage("dear npcs, u rnt attckin bak nd i dint kno if u were mad at me. pls halp bc i love u nd i want to live with u forever"); sendMessage("was it sumthin i sed, im sorry! pls fight bak."); }

Then put that in the attack NPC case. Don’t use project czar…

Hi call of duty, It didn`t work, Instead I put this and it worked:

public void Call of duty() { IsAFag = true; }

public void People who are not call of duty { IsAFag = false; }

String[] parkview; String parkview = new String[3]; parkview[1] = "Fag"; parkview[2] = "Emo"; parkview[3] = "Nerd"; for ( int i=0; i<9000; i++ ) { System.out.println("Parkview is a " + parkview[misc.random(3)]); }[/quote]

Oh that’s so funny.

Man, wow. So damn funny.

Read full topic

[quote=“parkview, post:6, topic:197700”][quote author=Call of Duty link=topic=262308.msg2172290#msg2172290 date=1207707028]

how do we make it so the npcs actually attack back? (Proj Czar)
[/quote]Declare this:

public void attackBack() { sendMessage("dear npcs, u rnt attckin bak nd i dint kno if u were mad at me. pls halp bc i love u nd i want to live with u forever"); sendMessage("was it sumthin i sed, im sorry! pls fight bak."); }

Then put that in the attack NPC case. Don’t use project czar…

Hi call of duty, It didn`t work, Instead I put this and it worked:

public void Call of duty() { IsAFag == true; }[/quote]Wouldn’t work because you didn’t declare IsAFag as a boolean, lawl, nice try.
